variant.bodyText: Books listed below that are marked with a † have been selected for review in a future issue, and reviewers have been assigned to each. Authors and publishers who wish their publications to be considered for review in Computational Linguistics should send a copy to the book review editor, Graeme Hirst, Department of Computer Science, University of Toronto, Toronto, Canada M5S 3G4. All relevant books received will be listed, but not all can be reviewed. Technical reports (other than dissertations) will not be listed or reviewed. Authors should be aware that some publishers will not send books for re- view (even when instructed to do so); authors wishing to enquire as to whether their book has been received for review may contact the book review editor. Readers who wish to be considered as book reviewers for the journal should contact the book review editor, outlining their qualifica- tions, by e-mail at gh@cs.toronto.edu or at the address above. †Semisupervised Learning for Computational Linguistics Steven Abney (University of Michigan) Chapman & Hall / CRC, 2007, (Computer science and data analysis series, edited by David Madigan et al.), 2008, xi+308 pp; hardbound, ISBN 978-1-58488-559-7, $79.95, £44.99 †Words and Intelligence I: Selected papers by Yorick Wilks Khurshid Ahmad, Christopher Brewster, and Mark Stevenson (editors) (Trinity College, Dublin and University of Sheffield) Springer (Text, Speech and Language Technology series, edited by Nancy Ide and Jean V´eronis, volume 35), 2007, xiv+279 pp; hardbound, ISBN 978-1-4020-5834-2, $139.00 Discourse on the Move: Using corpus analysis to describe discourse structure
variant.affiliation: Douglas Biber, Ulla Connor, and Thomas A. Upton (Northern Arizona University and
variant.table: Indiana University–Indianapolis) John Benjamins Publishing (Studies in corpus linguistics, edited by Elena Tognini-Bonelli, volume 28), 2007, xii+289 pp; hardbound, ISBN 978-90-272-2302-9, $142.00, €105.00 Understanding Minimalist Syntax: Lessons from locality in long-distance dependencies Cedric Boeckx (Harvard University) Blackwell Publishing, 2008, xii+173 pp; paperbound, ISBN 987-1-4051-5795-7, $34.95 Computation, Information, Cognition: The nexus and the liminal Gordana Dodig Crnkovic and Susan Stuart (editors) (University of M¨alardalen and University of Glasgow) Newcastle: Cambridge Scholars Publishing, 2007, xxiv+366 pp; hardbound, ISBN 978-1-84718-090-2, £39.99, $79.99 Reliable Reasoning: Induction and statistical learning theory
variant.bodyText: Gilbert Harman and Sanjeev Kulkarni (Princeton University) The MIT Press, 2007, x+108 pp; hardbound, ISBN978-0-262-08360-7, $30.00, £18.95 Language, Consciousness, Culture: Essays on mental structure Ray Jackendoff (Tufts University) The MIT Press, 2007, xxiv+403 pp; hardbound, ISBN 978-0-262-10119-6, $36.00 Natural Language Processing for Online Applications: Text retrieval, extraction, and categorization (second edition) Peter Jackson and Isabelle Moulinier (Thomson Corporation) John Benjamins Publishing Company (Natural language processing series, edited by Ruslan Mitkov, volume 5), 2007, x+231 pp; paperbound, ISBN 978-90-272-4993-7, $39.95, €33.00 Variation and Change in the Lexicon: A corpus-based analysis of adjectives in English ending in -ic and ical Mark Kaunisto (University of Tampere) Rodopi (Language and computers series, volume 63), 2007, ix+364 pp; hardbound, ISBN 978-90-420-2233-1, €75.00 Genesis Redux: Essays in the history and philosophy of artificial life Jessica Riskin (editor) (Stanford University) The University of Chicago Press, 2007, xvii+389 pp; hardbound,
variant.reference: ISBN 978-0-226-72080-7, $65.00, £41.00; paperbound, ISBN 978-0-226-72081-4, $25.00, £16.00 †Arabic Computational Morphology: Knowledge-based and empirical methods Abdelhadi Soudi, Antal van den Bosch, and G¨unter Neumann (editors) (Ecole Nationale de l’Industrie Min´erale, Morocco; Tilburg University; and Deutches Forschungszentrum f¨ur K¨unstliche Intelligenz) Springer (Text, Speech and Language Technology series, edited by Nancy Ide and Jean V´eronis, volume 38), 2007, viii+305 pp; hardbound, ISBN 978-1-4020-6045-8, $159.00 Understanding Language: A basic course in linguistics Elizabeth Grace Winkler (University of Western Kentucky) Continuum, 2007, xv+255 pp; hardbound, ISBN 978-0-82648482-6, $110.00; paperbound, ISBN 978-0-8264-8483-3, $19.95
